age.title: Age Calculator
age.description: Calculate your exact age in years, months, and days, and see how many days are left until your next birthday.
age.howItWorks: The age calculator works by computing the precise difference between your birth date and the current date. It analyzes complete years first, then remaining months, and finally days. The tool accounts for leap years and varying month lengths to ensure accurate results.
useCases: Calculate exact age for official documents and job applications
Find out when your next birthday is and plan celebrations
Track children's age in days and months for medical follow-ups
Determine age eligibility for various programs and services
seoTips: Enter your birth date accurately for correct results
Use the calculator to know your age in different units (days, hours)
Save the result for future reference when needed
commonMistakes: Entering incorrect birth date or wrong format
Confusing Gregorian and other calendar systems
Forgetting that age changes daily, not just yearly

faqs.question: How is age calculated in years, months, and days?
faqs.answer: Age is calculated by finding the difference between your birth date and today's date. First, we count complete years, then remaining months, and finally remaining days. For example, if born on March 15, 2000, and today is January 10, 2024, you would be 23 years, 9 months, and 26 days old.

faqs.question: How are leap years handled in age calculation?
faqs.answer: Our calculator accounts for leap years (years divisible by 4, except century years not divisible by 400). February 29th birthdays are calculated correctly, and the extra day in leap years is included in the total day count.

faqs.question: What is the difference between chronological age and biological age?
faqs.answer: Chronological age is your exact age based on your birth date. Biological age reflects how well your body functions compared to average people of your chronological age. This calculator determines chronological age; biological age requires medical assessments.

faqs.question: Can I calculate the age of a deceased person?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can use the calculator to find out what age a deceased person would have been if still alive by entering their birth date.

faqs.question: Why is my lunar age different from my solar age?
faqs.answer: The lunar year (Hijri) is about 11 days shorter than the solar year (Gregorian), so your lunar age will be higher than your Gregorian age.

age.error_future: Birth date cannot be in the future

bar-bat-mitzvah-calculator.title: Bar/Bat Mitzvah Calculator

bar-bat-mitzvah-calculator.howItWorks: The tool calculates Bar Mitzvah (13 years for males) or Bat Mitzvah (12 years for females) date based on the birth date in the Hebrew calendar, then converts to Gregorian.
useCases: Find your child's Bar/Bat Mitzvah date
Book venue and services in advance

Send invitations at the right time
seoTips: Select the correct gender as the age differs
Consult with a rabbi for final confirmation
commonMistakes: Forgetting that calculation is based on Hebrew calendar
Confusing Bar Mitzvah and Bat Mitzvah ages
Not accounting for the ceremony usually being on Shabbat

faqs.question: What is Bar/Bat Mitzvah?
faqs.answer: It is a Jewish religious event marking the coming of age. Bar Mitzvah is for males at 13, Bat Mitzvah is for females at 12.

faqs.question: Why is the age different for males and females?
faqs.answer: According to Jewish tradition, girls reach spiritual maturity a year earlier than boys, so they celebrate a year earlier.

faqs.question: When is the ceremony held?
faqs.answer: The ceremony is usually held on the first Shabbat (Saturday) after the Hebrew birthday, when the young person reads from the Torah for the first time.

lunar-age.title: Lunar Age Calculator
lunar-age.description: Calculate your age in the lunar Hijri calendar in years, months, and days.
lunar-age.howItWorks: This tool calculates your age in the Hijri lunar calendar. Since the lunar year is about 11 days shorter than the solar year, your lunar age will be higher than your Gregorian age.
useCases: Know your age in the Hijri calendar
seoTips: Enter your Gregorian birth date to get lunar age
Compare your lunar and solar ages
Find out your Hijri birth date
commonMistakes: Expecting lunar age to equal solar age
Forgetting that the lunar year is shorter
Confusing Hijri and Gregorian birth dates

faqs.question: Why is my lunar age higher than my Gregorian age?
faqs.answer: Because the lunar year (approximately 354 days) is shorter than the solar year (365 days) by about 11 days, so more lunar years pass in the same period.

faqs.question: How do I calculate the difference between the two ages?
faqs.answer: Approximately, every 33 solar years equals 34 lunar years. Or multiply your solar age by 1.03 for a rough estimate.

faqs.question: What is the importance of knowing lunar age?
faqs.answer: The Hijri calendar is used for Islamic religious events, and some religious rulings depend on lunar age.
